title: Zap Zits in Photoshop
introduction: Learn how to erase pimples through three simple steps using Photoshop by following this tutorial.

steps.step1: Once you have mounted your Rifle Scope, set your zero. "Zeroing" you rifle scope is the single most important thing you should do in terms of improving the accuracy of your shot. If you fail to zero your Rifle scope you will not hit your target - FACT.
steps.step2: # Position your eyepiece, set the distance to your shooting eye so the position is correct when in your shooting position. Your image should be sharp and clear when you look through the eyepiece, when this is achieved your know you are in the correct place.
steps.step3: Level your crosshair. Your rifle should be held in a steady position, the best way to achieve this is to set your rifle on a stand so that the rifle stock is level and square to the ground level. Now you need to rotate the crosshair so that the vertical crosshair is at top dead centre, imagine a line through the crosshair that runs directly through the centre of your rifle.
steps.step4: Tighten your mounting base securely insuring that the crosshair remains top dead centre. Check again that your crosshair is top dead centre then, gradually tighten your mounting rings. Tighten each screw only half a thread at a time constantly checking the crosshair to ensure that it has remained top dead centre. Tighten the screws using opposite corners like when tightening a car head gasket.
steps.step5: Determine the distance at which you wish to zero your rifle scope. Usually this is the distance at which you are most likely to shoot when in the field. Set a target at the required distance.
steps.step6: Get yourself in a steady shooting position, its important that your rifle is steady as any movement will affect you rifle scopes zero position.
steps.step7: Remove the caps from your rifle scope's windage and elevation turrets.
steps.step8: Aim at the centre of your target and take your first shot (it is important to do this on a day with minimal wind).
steps.step9: Now adjust your elevation turret up or down and you windage turret left or right ( depending on where your shot hit the target). What you need to do is adjust the crosshair in the scope to where the shot hit the target - the crosshair must "follow" where the shot hit.
steps.step10: Take another shot once adjusted (hopefully it should be closer to the centre of your target) and continue to adjust your windage and elevation until your are consistently hitting the centre of your target.
steps.step11: Once "zeroed" replace your turret caps and you are ready to go!

Warnings: Please wear eye protection when setting up your rifle scopes as ricochets can happen.
RelatedwikiHows: Use Adjustable Objective Rifle Scopes|How to Use Adjustable Objective Rifle Scopes
Sight the Scope of a Rifle in and Zero It|How to Sight the Scope of a Rifle in and Zero It
Choose a Scope for a Sniper Rifle|How to Choose a Scope for a Sniper Rifle
Sight In a Rifle|How to Sight In a Rifle

title: Zero Your Rifle Scope
introduction: This article explains how to set up a rifle scope from the initial mounting, through to "zeroing" your rifle scope.

steps.step1: Find a shooting area, or range that  allows for at least {{convert|100|yd|m|adj=on|1}} shots. If you do not have a shooting range and are using property make sure you are shooting into a bank or area that stops the bullet.
steps.step2: Find a stable place to set up the equipment. It's nice to have a shooting table of some sort that allows enough room to set a whole rifle on.
steps.step3: SAFELY load the rifle up. Keep fingers off the trigger until you are ready to fire.
steps.step4: Once the rifle is ready and there is nobody down range, place a finger on the trigger. Finger placement on the trigger is important for consistent and accurate shooting. Make sure the trigger sits in between the tip of the finger and the first joint. Once that is done flip the safety, control breathing, and pull the trigger.
steps.step5: After the shot has been fired check the target. If the point of impact is not visible then decrease the range you are shooting from and repeat the steps.
steps.step6: Before ever moving the scope's dials, make sure the scope's windage and elevation dials adjustment settings are understood. EXAMPLE: Most scopes use either a {{convert|1/2|in|cm|adj=on|1|1}} or {{convert|1/4|in|cm|adj=on|1|1}} MOA at {{convert|100|yd|m|1}}. This means that at {{convert|100|yd|m|1}}, every click while rotating the scope dials moves the cross hairs {{convert|1/2|in|cm|adj=on|1|1}} or {{convert|1/4|in|cm|adj=on|1|1}}, depending on the scopes instructions. Increasing or decreasing the distance from which you are shooting will cause the numbers to change. The closer the target is in comparison to the scopes set distance, the more the dials will have to be turned. The farther the target is in comparison to the scopes set distance, the less the dials will have to be turned.
steps.step7: Some get confused with which direction to move the knobs even after knowing where the point of impact was. Some scopes are different, but almost all scopes use the technique that I will explain in this next example.
steps.step8: * EXAMPLE: The targets at {{convert|100|yd|m|1}}. A scope is being used that is set for {{convert|1/2|in|cm|adj=on|1|1}} MOA at {{convert|100|yd|m|1}}. One round has been fired and it's hitting {{convert|5|in|cm|1}} low and {{convert|2|in|cm|1}} to the left. Well, according to the scope every segment rotated the scope knob is {{convert|1/2|in|cm|adj=on|1|1}} at {{convert|100|yd|m|1}}. So, look at the directional arrows on the elevation. The gun is hitting {{convert|5|in|cm|1}} low so turn the knob UP 10 clicks. Then move to the windage knob. The gun is hitting {{convert|2|in|cm|1}} to the left. So, look at your directional arrows. Turn the knob 4 clicks to the right.
steps.step9: Once steps 1-7 have been done, get the gun ready to fire again. Then, check the point of impact, if its good, then leave it. If it's still off then use the dials to correct again. In almost all cases the dials must be turned the way the bullet needs to come. EXAMPLE: If the bullets hitting left, turn the dial right using the correct amount of rotations.

Warnings: Shooting any weapon can be dangerous. READ ALL instructions and warnings before even handling a firearm. Bring ear and eye protection. Make sure you are shooting into a bank.

Tips: An orange with the zest removed can still be consumed. All citrus fruit can still be used for juicing even when the zest is removed so do not discard fruit when the skin is gone.

Store leftover zest in the refrigerator for two or three days in a sealed container. If you want to store zest longer then freeze zest in single tablespoon portions. The zest will keep in the freezer for up to a year.
If youre using both the zest and the juice of a citrus fruit in your recipe then be sure to zest first. After all of the juice has been removed removing zest becomes challenging.

If you dont own a zester or a microplane then you can place your citrus fruit against the fine side of a box grater and grate it to remove the zest. However youll need to remove the zest slowly and gently to avoid grating off the bitter white pith.

steps.step1: Steps

title: Zest a Lemon
introduction: Making your own fresh zest at home is easy. Lemon zest has many uses, such as adding flavor to baked goods, serving as a garnish on certain foods or for flavoring drinks. Various common kitchen implements can be used to create zest, such as a grater, vegetable peeler, knife or microplane. The method for each implement is explained below.

Tips: If the lime is too soft to zest effectively put it in the freezer for two minutes to make it firm.refhttp:ideas.thenest.comdinnerrecipescookingadvicearticleshowtousezester.aspxMsdVisit1ref

The best limes to zest are brightly colored and smell strongly when scratched. Thinskinned limes such as key limes may be difficult to zest.refhttp:www.azcentral.comstylehfefoodcooking101articlescook101zest.htmlref

If you dislike cleaning your microplane you can try putting a layer of plastic wrap or wax paper between the microplane and the lime while zesting.refhttp:whatscookingamerica.netlemons.htmref This may simply shred the plastic or paper however so use only sturdy materials.
If youre using both the zest and the juice of a lime zest the lime before juicing it.
You can refrigerate limes that have had the zest removed and juice them later. Wrap them in plastic wrap to keep them from drying out.

title: Zest a Lime
introduction: [[Image:Zest a Lime Intro.jpg|right|300px]]The zest of a lime is the outer green layer of peel, which contains fragrant and flavorful oils. Lime zest adds intense flavor to cocktails, desserts and a number of other recipes. The easiest tool for creating fine lime zest for cooking is a microplane, while long garnish strips or cocktail twists can be made with a traditional zester. However, with a little more effort and practice, either form of zest can be created with nothing more than a sharp knife or vegetable peeler.

title: Zest an Orange
introduction: Orange zest is the top layer of an orange's peel. It contains the fruit's oils and adds a bright citrus flavor to a variety of dishes. There are several kitchen utensils you can use to zest an orange, including a microplane, grater, vegetable peeler or knife. See Step 1 to start making fresh orange zest.

Warnings: Adding encrypted files to a compressed folder will cause them to be unencrypted.

title: Zip Files Together
introduction: You can zip several files together to create one compressed file. Zipping files allows you to save hard drive space, send files more quickly over the Internet, and to attach certain file types (such as .exe) to emails. In Windows XP, Vista, and 7 you can either select each file and send them to a compressed folder or create a compressed folder and drag files to it. With Mac OS X, you use the "Compress" option with multiple files selected. The guide below describes each of these methods.

steps.step1: Create a folder and place all your images in there. Right-click on the folder.
steps.step2: Choose the "Create archive" option.
steps.step3: Click on the "More options" button in the dialogue window.
steps.step4: Choose the "Store" compression mode from the list.
steps.step6: Voilà! The archive is ready and waiting for being emailed!

Tips: If you dont have B1 Free Archiver installed on your computer  visit http:b1.org and download it absolutely free of charge.

title: Zip Files Without Compressing Them with B1 Free Archiver
introduction: Let's say you have a bunch of .img files and you want to send them to your friend via email. Files of that type as well as videos are already in compressed form. You know compression won't make them smaller but it's still easier to send them as one archive than sending all images one by one. Any solution? Yes. Zip them without compression with B1 Free Archiver.

steps.step1: Download [https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.b1.android.archiver&hl=en B1 Free Archiver]. It is available for free on Google Play Market. Install and run it.
steps.step2: Go to files. This application functions as a file manager, so you can freely navigate through your folders. Once you are inside the folder with files you wish to compress, press the zipper icon at the top right corner.
steps.step3: Select files. Choose file(s)/folder(s) you wish to compress, then tap “Create Archive” button.
steps.step4: Select archive format. You can choose between ZIP and B1 formats (the latter actually has a great compression ratio). Then enter the name for your new archive. If you wish to set a password for your archive check the Protect with password option and enter the desired password. Hit the OK button once you’re ready.

Tips: If you want to compress an individual filefolder  long tap and select Compress from the menu. This menu will also allow you to move rename delete files etc.
title: Zip Files on Android Using B1 Zip Archiver
introduction: The Android platform is rather convenient in comparison with some other popular portable devices operating systems in terms of file management, data storage and media share. What makes it even easier is the usage of good old archives. Archiving applications compress your files and folders, reduce their size and help you keep things organized. You will often find yourself in need of sending or storing a bunch of work documentation, study materials or personal photos, and it will be done much easier if those files are compressed.

title: Zip a File in Windows XP
introduction: Compressing, or zipping, a file is the process of creating smaller versions of large files. Zipping a file has several major benefits, such as saving storage space on your computer and making it easier to send large files through email. Depending on your email client, you may have limited storage space or it may take several minutes for an email with a large file attachment to complete the sending and receiving process. You can also create zipped folders that will automatically zip any files that you place into the folder. Computers with Windows XP have the option to zip files and folders easily, since this feature is built into their operating systems.

title: Zip a Folder
introduction: Compressing, or "zipping," files on a computer allows you to send and save them in smaller file sizes. It is especially useful when sending media, like photos and videos. You can learn how to zip a folder on Mac or Windows operating systems (OS). Start zipping files on your computer.

steps.step1: Visit the WinZip website to download and install the WinZip compression utility on your computer system.
steps.step2: Open the Start menu using the green button at the bottom-left of your screen and select "My Computer."
steps.step3: Use the Windows Explorer window that opens up to go to the folder where
steps.step4: Accept the WinZip terms of service.
steps.step5: Create a new zip project by pressing the "New" button at the top.
steps.step6: Pick the location where you want to save the zipped PSD file and assign a name for the new file.
steps.step7: Hit the "OK" button. This will take you to the "Add" window.
steps.step8: Use the file browser to find and select the PSD file that you want to zip.
steps.step9: Zip the file by pressing the "Add" button. The zipped PSD file will appear in the folder that you had chosen with the filename that you had assigned.

Tips: Many computers that are sold with the Windows operating system already have WinZip preinstalled by the manufacturer so you may not have to download and install it yourself.

When you zip a PSD file its size becomes smaller. This makes it easier to share the file online or reduce the storage space required to save the file on your hard drive. You can use WinZip to decompress the file into its original size and PSD format later on.
WinZip is not just for compressing Photoshop Deluxe files. It can be used to compress many other file formats.
Warnings: If you are using a version of Windows that was released before Windows XP you may have to open WinZip manually instead of using the Add to Zip file shortcut through Windows Explorer.

Originally developed for the Adobe Photoshop software, the PSD format is now also used by many other programs with multi-layer image editing capabilities. You can use a compression utility called [[Unzip a File or Folder With Winzip|WinZip]] to zip a PSD file into a [[Open a .Zip File Without Winzip|compressed format]].

Your resolution will be provided in the Screen Resolution section.

title: Zip a PowerPoint File
introduction: A PowerPoint file can be compressed, or zipped, if the file size becomes too large to store on your computer or to send through email. In some cases, PowerPoint files can become large as a result of including multiple images or images with large pixel sizes in your presentation. In addition to zipping a PowerPoint file itself, there are also steps you can take to compress the images within your presentation.

steps.step1: Download the WinZip utility from the official WinZip website and install it on your computer.
steps.step2: Go to "My Computer" from the Start menu to open Windows Explorer.
steps.step3: Browse to the folder containing the MP3 file that you want to zip.
steps.step4: Right-click on the MP3 file's name.
steps.step5: Mouse-over "Zip Program" or "Send to" in the pop-up menu (you should see 1 of the 2 options depending on which version of Windows you are using).
steps.step6: Click on "Add to Zip file." The MP3 will be zipped and the new zipped file will be added in the same folder containing the original MP3.

Tips: WinZip may already be preinstalled in some computers.
Other utility programs that you can use to zip an MP3 file include PentaZip PowerArchiver and PKZip. Their method of use for converting files to Zip format is very similar to that of WinZip.
Select multiple files at once in the file browser by pressing down the Control Ctrl key on your keyboard and clicking on all the files that you want to select.

title: Zip an MP3 File
introduction: MPEG Audio Layer 3 (MP3) files are usually quite small in size because they are already compressed to remove any sounds that would not be audible on a noticeable level to the human ear. However, on certain occasions you may want to compress an MP3 further into Zip format, especially if you have a long song or speech that can make the size of the MP3 quite large. The most popular program you can use to zip an MP3 file is WinZip, a file compression utility developed by Microsoft.

Tips: PeaZip Portable is available for all supported platforms and does not require installation. It is useful to be deployed on a removable media or over a network or when lacking of rights for installing software on the target machine
The software features secure deletion to permanently remove files and archives after the use
As an option history of recently viewed directories and archives can be deleted and turned off
Warnings: Zip format can be read by any archive manager utility and most systems i.e. Windows XP and newer features basic tools for Unzip. Using archive formats different than Zip may bring various additional features resulting in several benefits but the receiver of the file may lack the tools to handle it.
title: Zip and Unzip Files with Peazip
introduction:
Zip is a common compressed archive file format: an archive file is meant to combine multiple files together for easier management i.e. backup, sharing through mail or cloud or any other network service, etc. File compression basically uses statistical models to map the original data to a smaller output, which allows both to spare storage for backup and save upload and download bandwidth (and time) for sharing.

Over time, various archive file types emerged, introducing unique features to distinguish them from competitors, as stronger compression ratio, ability to split the output archive to met some constrains (i.e. mail attachment limit), error detection and correction, and encryption in order to enforce privacy if the file is stolen, or passed through public or third party controlled channels, i.e. mail server, or remote storage service. This brought users more choice and more features, but also the need for dedicated archive manager applications to fully use the potential of different file formats, either for creating own archives, and for extracting archives received or downloaded.

steps.step1: Stop conversations with other people.
steps.step2: Close your eyes if you want to.
steps.step3: Sit or lie down.
steps.step4: Pick a thought that is calming or something that requires quite a bit of thinking, but is not stressful. For example, how you are going to plan your garden, or going to the beach.
steps.step5: Start thinking about it and keep thinking. Keep your muscles relaxed - being tense can hinder the progress.
steps.step6: Vision leads to imagination. If you are trying to zone out per-say in a really boring meeting, find one, JUST ONE, object and STARE at it, (Coffee mug, pencil, window) don't move or think about anything in particular, just...stare.
steps.step7: Lose your focus. Other than blinking, don't move your eyes, if you really want to be "inside your imagination," allow your vision to lose focus.
steps.step8: Pin-pointed vision. There are people that can realize they are zoning out, while doing so, when their vision is coming to a pin-point, all is black except for that little pin-point. If you even think about moving your eyes, the pin-point widens and you regain your full vision again.

Tips: Where you are can affect this. For example it would be hard to do this at a crowded birthday party.
Use music only if it works for you some people find it helps them zone out but others end up focusing on the lyrics or beats.

You will be able to tell when you have zoned out because your surroundings seem to go into the background and you are living in your thoughts The best way I can describe it is like when you are in a dream and you can influence it you just feel relaxed and at peace with everything. If you feel your self slipping off to sleep dont stop it for me thats saying you are now relaxed.
It may not be a good idea to disconnect from your surroundings but this can be very calming.
Warnings: Never zone out when driving or operating dangerous machinery or if your attention is needed.
Zoning out is not a good idea in a class where your teacher may notice or you need to take notes or do work.
If you are really disconnected from your surroundings you may be at risk of being embarrassed when you are awakened.
Dont zone out at work.
Try not to stare at one spot for too long. You may notice that subject begin to smoke.
ThingsYoullNeed: A few good ideas to think about.
A place where you can have privacy and be alone.

title: Zone Out
introduction: This is like meditation or hypnosis in a sense, except you can do this comfortably for large amounts of time without suffering from boredom. This is a good way to relax while coming up with constructive ideas. Leave zoning out for when you have free time; it isn't something to practice during work or school hours.

steps.step1: Listen for key words. If your teacher has words he or she frequently uses, like, "Got it?!" or "Understand?!" This is good.
steps.step2: Wait for words that expect a response (Like "ok?") and say, "Yes madam, or "Ok Sir". But be careful, your teacher might be saying "Do you think that's okay?" and you would be caught, so do this carefully.
steps.step3: Think about a song you like in your "subconscious", and allow your mind to wander into other thoughts. Just keep listening for those words.
steps.step4: If your teacher yells at you, "ARE YOU LISTENING TO ME?!!?" and wakes you up, so to speak, just say "yes, I didn't think I was supposed to answer, like a rhetorical question...Sorry."
steps.step5: Try to go into a self-induced trance, and turn all sound that goes through the state of mind your in, sub, or logical, into vision, like colours, it’s called synesthesia, and it's hard to self-induce. But it's awesome!
steps.step6: Make sure you are still using about 12-17% brainpower of the state you're in, to stay in touch with the real world, to keep the other half of your mind listening. Think of it as waking up to an alarm clock, but not a pet jumping on to your bed to cuddle...
steps.step7: Don't get too cocky, check in on the real world every so often, and see if the conversation was headed where you thought, so you can answer at least some of the questions your teacher might ask at the end of what to you was a "great talk".
steps.step8: Try this short periods at a time a then start to go longer periods when you think you have got the hang of it.

Tips: Dont stare at herhim. Theyll notice your tactics.

Another tactic is mindrambling. You think of one topic and then you go off on another tangent until you think of two things that seem to have no relation at all except for the tangent your twisted sadistic mind came up with.
Dont say Wait what were you saying After they ask you something they will probably get angry that you were not listening.
Warnings: Dont let your eyes droop and dont fall asleep try and think of things that are somewhat interesting to keep you awake.
Keep zoning out and you might miss something very important like There is no school tomorrow

Dont let them catch you know what they say and consider all the possibilities. You dont want to look out only for a select few things because your teacher might say something important and youll miss it.
Do not try this if you might get fired
ThingsYoullNeed: A friend to practice the activities described above.

introduction: Ok, so you have this really boring teacher, and she always brings you into the hall, or gets mad, and lectures you, and stuff. Are you tired of it? Well, here's a perfect solution! This can be used with bosses, or teachers, or even parents and principals!

steps.step1: Open up Microsoft Word to your document you'd like to zoom into.
steps.step2: Scroll to the area you'd like to better see.
steps.step3: Understand that there are multiple ways to find and select the zoom-in/out buttons.
steps.step4: *  There are buttons within the Menu toolbar from the top of your screen.
steps.step5: *  There is a button in the Standard toolbar of Microsoft Word, that will allow you to Zoom-into our out-of your document.
steps.step6: Figure out which way is easiest to try and zoom in/out of your document.
steps.step7: *  Select the View menu bar at the top of the screen, and select Zoom.  Select your Zoom level.
steps.step8: **  A larger number than your initial zoom level signifies a zoom-in of a preferred amount.  A smaller number than your initial zoom level signifies a zoom-out of a preferred amount.
steps.step9: **  You can also choose to provide a Customized zoom level, by clicking the "Percent" drop-down box and typing your own predefined zoom level %.
steps.step10: *  Look for the zoom drop-down from the Standard toolbar.  Click the drop-down option, and select your zoom level.
steps.step11: **  You can also click this same box and type your own customized zoom-level number.
steps.step12: ** No need to type the percent sign in either of these styles.

Tips: These zoom steps are meant for users of Word 2003.  Since 2007 and 2010 are more graphical oriented there are several other methods to obtain the zoom options stated in this article.  Refer to your Microsoft Word 2007 or 2010 Help documents for information on how to zoom into or out of your document.  Use the search term zoom into a document

title: Zoom In or Out of a Microsoft Word Document
introduction: Sometimes, you need to really get close to what you are doing in a software program. This article helps you with MS Word.

steps.step1: While using a zoom-friendly application (more common instances are web pages, email messages and photos), place your thumb and pointer finger at opposing points of the screen as if preparing to pinch a cheek.
steps.step2: Gently move your fingers away from each other. Note that the speed at which your fingers are spread will influence the rate of zoom.
steps.step3: To zoom back out, reverse the motion and gently "pinch" your fingers towards each other while keeping contact with the screen.

Tips: An alternate method is to simply doubletap on an image or object you would like to zoom into or out of. Though the zoom distance is preset this can often be a handy shortcut for quickly glancing at something in detail and can sometimes be repeated to zoom deeper into highdetail objects like maps.
Though this guide applies specifically to iOS devices the action will work on nearly any modern multitouch screen.
It can help to use your fingernail and fingertip to add precision and avoid obscuring details of what youd like to zoom in on.
While zoomed in some applications will allow you to rotate an object a map or a picture for instance by simply rotating your fingers around the same center point you were zooming in an out from.

title: Zoom With a Web Browser
introduction: Internet accessibility is important even if you are not suffering a visual impairment. Web pages should be designed with this in mind. Early web browsers were able to increase text size but not pictures or much dynamic content. Modern web browsers recognize this accessibility need and offer features to increase the size of text and pictures.

steps.step1: First go to your Profile.
steps.step2: Hover your mouse to your display picture and click Update Profile Picture.
steps.step3: Choose Edit Thumbnail and this will come up.
steps.step4: Right click your thumbnail and pick inspect element.
steps.step5: Then the developer tools will come up. Find the width and height below.
steps.step6: Double click the part where the width and height is in the same line and then edit the width and height. After changing the value of width and height, press Enter.
steps.step7: And then close the developer tools by pressing F12 on the keyboard. There you have it, click Save to save the changes .This technique is very simple.
steps.step8: Just click your display picture to see if the comments and likes are still there.

steps.step1: [[Image:Zoom options.png|right|180px]]Zoom a document to 100% percent. Click the 100% icon in the View tab, the document will then be displayed in accordance with the ratio of 100%.
steps.step2: [[Image:Zoom document in writer 2013.png|right|179px]]Zoom a document to other levels.  Alternatively, you can click the Zoom icon to open the Zoom dialogue box and enter the proportion you prefer. Click the OK button to complete the operation.
steps.step3: Zoom a document to page width. Click the Page Width icon in the View tab and the page width of the document will be zoomed to the width of the window.
steps.step4: Zoom a document to display one/two pages in window. In the View tab, click the One Page icon and the current document will be displayed in one page in the window. Click the Two Pages icon and two pages of the current document fits in the window.

title: Zoom a Document in Kingsoft Office Writer 2013
introduction: To zoom a document in Writer 2013, the options are as follows:

steps.step1: Locate the plus (+) and minus (-) buttons on your computer’s keyboard. They are typically at the end of the row of numbers just below F10 or at the rightmost side of the numeric keypad.
steps.step2: Locate the CTRL key (for Windows) or the CMD key (for Mac).
steps.step3: *There are two CTRL keys for Windows, located at the bottom row edges of the alphanumeric keypads; both are under the SHIFT keys.
steps.step4: *There are also two CMD keys for Mac; both are beside the Spacebar.
steps.step5: Launch your preferred web browser. Do this by double-clicking the browser’s icon on the desktop, in your taskbar or dock, or in your programs list.
steps.step6: Head to a web page. Go to a website whose contents you want to enlarge for better viewing. Do this by typing in the website’s URL in the address bar at the top of the browser.
steps.step7: Enlarge the words. Once on the page, press and hold the CTRL or CMD then press the plus (+) key. The words and images will be magnified.
steps.step8: * Press + again while still holding the CMD or CTRL button to enlarge the words further.

Tips: To zoom out press the minus  key instead of the plus  key while holding the CTRL or CMD keys. es:ampliar una pgina web para agrandar las palabras it:Zoomare una Pagina Web per Ingrandirne il Contenuto pt:Dar Zoom em uma Pgina da Web para Ampliar as Palavras ru:
title: Zoom a Web Page to Enlarge the Words
introduction: Enlarging the words displayed on your web browser can help in improving how visible and legible the contents of a web page are. The process is similar across different platforms and web browsers, so it is a convenient trick. To learn how to enlarge words of a web page, see step 1.

steps.step1: Open your iMovie program and select the iMovie project  you wish to add the zoom effect to.
steps.step2: Click on the video clip you are applying the zoom effect to within the event browser window in the upper middle portion of the iMovie project screen. This will make the selected clip show up in the window to the right of the video clip event browser. Verify you have selected the appropriate video clip to apply the zoom effect to.
steps.step3: Click on the "Crop" button located on the middle pane separating the top project workspace from the bottom. This button is designated by a square with the 2 lines of the square that create the corners overlapping each other. This button will bring up "Fit," "Crop," and "Ken Burns" video editing effects onto the selected video clip within the editing viewer.
steps.step4: Select the "Ken Burns" button located at the upper middle portion of the video editing screen. This will bring up a green rectangle and a red rectangle.
steps.step5: Place the rectangles according to where you want the zoom effect to begin and where you want the effect to end.
steps.step6: * Place the green rectangle over the image area you want the effect to zoom in on when the clip starts; place the red rectangle over the area you want the zoom effect to end on. For example, the green rectangle can be focused on a smaller area, which will create a zoomed in effect, and the red rectangle can be placed in a larger aspect of the clip to zoom out. You can move these rectangles around by clicking and dragging each around to the specific spot you need the zoom effect to take place.
steps.step7: * Also, resize the rectangles accordingly by dragging the corners of each rectangle back and forth, resizing the image area.
steps.step8: * Selecting the double arrow button at the bottom of the video editing screen will make the green and red rectangles swap positions.
steps.step9: Preview the Ken Burns effect you have just created by clicking on the "Play" button in the video viewer/editor window. This button is designated by the play symbol (sideways triangle). Adjust the rectangles to get the effect exactly how you want.
steps.step10: Click on the "Done" button once you have modified the effect to its desired position to apply the effects you have just created.

Tips: In older versions of the iMovie program the Ken Burns effect is only applicable to still frame video and photos.

title: Zoom iMovie
introduction: IMovie allows users to use a zoom feature with any photo, still frame video shot, or video clip that has been imported into your iMovie project. The act of zooming in and out and panning back and forth over a photo, still frame video shot, or video is called the "Ken Burns Effect" and is how the effect buttons are designated within the iMovie program. Ken Burns is a noted film documentarian that developed this particular zoom and pan technique.

title: Zoom in Internet Explorer
introduction: The Internet Explorer zoom function is a relatively new introduction to the web browser. Internet Explorer 5 allowed rudimentary text zoom, but not entire page zoom. Internet Explorer 6 didn’t have built-in page zoom, although you could download plug-ins that would allow you to zoom images. With Internet Explorer 7 and 8 the zoom function became much more robust. You can now zoom text as well as the entire page by following a few simple steps.

Tips: You can use the same procedure when applied to other mods using Magic Launcher.

title: Zoom in on a Mac
introduction: Do you find yourself squinting at the screen sometimes, and wish things were just "bigger?" Whether you have vision disabilities, or just like to zoom in for a close view of your screen, it's easy to do with just a couple keystrokes. This article will show you how to zoom in for a closeup of your browser or desktop.

title: Zoom in on a PC
introduction: [[Zoom Out on a PC|Zooming out]] and in on a PC is very simple. Here are several methods to do so!
